findings.title: PTM - Pair Token Mocking
findings.description: The contract does not properly validate token pairs, leaving it susceptible to potential token mocking attacks.

findings.title: TPP - Token Pair Prevalidation
findings.description: The contract allows users to initiate swap transactions between two tokens without first checking if a token pair exists. This could result in the loss of funds if the contract is unable to find a liquidity pool for the specified token pair.

findings.title: AAO - Accumulated Amount Overflow
findings.description: The contract is using the variable `nonce` to accumulate values. The contract could lead to an overflow when the total value of a variable exceeds the maximum value that can be stored in that variable's data type.

findings.title: PTAI - Potential Transfer Amount Inconsistency
findings.description: The `transfer()` and `transferFrom()` functions are used to transfer a specified amount of tokens to an address. The fee or tax is an amount that is charged to the sender of an ERC20 token when tokens are transferred to another address. According to the specification, the transferred amount could potentially be less than the expected amount.

findings.title: MSC - Missing Sanity Checks
findings.description: The contract is processing variables that have not been properly sanitized and checked that they form the proper shape.

findings.title: CO - Code Optimization
findings.description: There are code segments that could be optimized. A segment may be optimized so that it becomes a smaller size, consumes less memory, executes more rapidly, or performs fewer operations.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide is a set of guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code. Adhering to a style guide can help improve the readability and maintainability of the Solidity

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: It's important to carefully design and implement the events in a contract, and to ensure that all required events are included.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables that have been configured on user-supplied input without proper check for the case where a value is zero.
